lhm 1.0.0

Class containing life-history information

Source: R/lhm-class.R, R/lhm.R
lhm-class.Rd

This is an S4 object class that contains the life-history information necessary to calculate derived quantities using life history theory, such as the intrinsic growth rate \(r\) using the Euler-Lotka equation.

Initialisation is usually through a call to lhm(ainf,iter). Using this approach specific life-history data can then be included through the assignment functions nmort, size, mass, sr and maturity.

Usage

lhm(ainf, iter = 1, ...)

Arguments

ainf

the assumed asymptotic age

iter

the number of iterations

...

additional arguments nmort, size, mass, sr and maturity that can be optionally specified at initialisation of the object

Slots

iter

the number of Monte-Carlo iterations

ainf

the asymptotic age (equal to the maximum age for each life-history data vector)

sr

the type of stock-recruitment relationship used, either Beverton-Holt ('BH') or Ricker ('RK')

lhdat

list of data matrices containing life-history data-at-age, specifically, mass, maturity, natural mortality and survivorship, as well as a vector of steepness values

See also

See the appropriate documentation in mass, maturity, nmort, size, sr and survivorship for how these are specified, accessed and assigned. See documentation for rCalc on how to calculate \(r\) from an lhm object. Use iterate to increase the number of iterations after the object has been created. Use iteration to access a particular iteration.

Examples

# initialise lhm-class object
ainf <- 100
iter <- 1
dat <- lhm(ainf, iter)

# assign life-history data
nmort(dat)    <- list(mu=0.18)
size(dat)     <- list(mu=list(Linf=106.5,k=0.229,t0=0.01)) 
mass(dat)     <- list(mu=list(a=1.7e-9,b=3.328))
sr(dat)       <- list(type='BH',mu=0.9)
maturity(dat) <- list(mu=list(acrit=8))
